metadata.title: CVE-2019-9803 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
The Upgrade-Insecure-Requests (UIR) specification states that if UIR isenabled through Content Security Policy (CSP), navigation to a same-originURL must be upgraded to HTTPS. Firefox will incorrectly navigate to an HTTPURL rather than perform the security upgrade requested by the CSP in somecircumstances, allowing for potential man-in-the-middle attacks on thelinked resources. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 66.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9803` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '66.0+build3-0ubuntu0.16.04.2').
